drupalNodeEvent.title: Situating Space through Verse: A Study of the Ten Verses of Hà Tiên by Mo Tianci (Mạc Thiên Tứ)

field_organizers.processed: Hong Kong Institute for the Humanities and Social Sciences, The University of Hong Kong

field_description.processed: Hà Tiên was more than a mere trading port during the eighteenth century. After the death of Mo Jiu, his son and successor Mo Tianci (Mạc Thiên Tứ) made use of his connections and capital earned from overseas trade to forge a horizontally integrated, transnational civic sphere that stretched from Jiangnan to Canton and Cambodia. The Pavilion for Summoning Worthies that he established provided a platform for lower-level elites across East Asia from different backgrounds and political views to actively interact with one another and forge a community of letters. Through the study of the Ten Verses of Hà Tiên, this talk attempts to understand the implied meaning and emotions behind the poetic verses of Mo Tianci and the other participants.
